item.title: The French Notebooks Linked to Celebrities like Kendall Jenner and Lana Del Ray
item.description: A Parisian brand’s leather notebooks have for some become a status symbol to flaunt online and off.
item.dc:creator: Yola Mzizi

item.title: The Priest, the Financier and the $10 Million Townhouse
item.description: When a pastor learned his childhood home might undergo a glow-up, he saw his beloved Brooklyn further receding — and took to a different kind of pulpit.
item.dc:creator: Ginia Bellafante
item.media:description: The home in question, a modernist townhouse in Brooklyn Heights designed by Mary and Joseph Merz.

item.title: Would You Wear Balenciaga at the Gym?
item.description: In Pierpaolo Piccioli’s second collection, he stretches the label into some new shapes.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman and Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Lamorna Ash Goes From a D.J. Set to Church, and Back Again
item.description: When the writer Lamorna Ash set out to explore young people’s relationship to faith and religion, she found herself questioning her own.
item.dc:creator: Emma Goldberg and Jono White
item.category: Don't Forget We're Here Forever: A New Generation's Search for Religion (Book)
item.media:description: In her book “Don’t Forget We’re Here Forever,” Lamorna Ash wonders: “If I kept putting myself in the way of Christianity, would I eventually be converted?”

item.title: Men’s Coats That Make a Strong Impression
item.description: Come wintertime, it could be said that the coat, not the clothes, makes a man.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha
item.media:description: A hefty leathery overcoat had a strikingly high collar.

item.title: What the Bankruptcy of Saks Means for You
item.description: Answers to this and other questions about the financial crisis in America’s biggest luxury department store.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman and Jacob Bernstein
item.media:credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times
item.media:description: At the American Dream Mall in East Rutherford, N.J., a year ago.

item.title: Has Taylor Swift Finally Gotten Too Cringe for Some Swifties?
item.description: The mega star has always embraced cringe. Are fans still buying it?
item.dc:creator: Jessica Roy
item.media:credit: Richard Lautens/Toronto Star, via Getty Images
item.media:description: On social media, a small but vocal contingent contends that liking Taylor Swift is “cringe.”

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: A Yellow Winter Coat
item.description: A pair of Bernese Mountain dogs and their owner looked charming while strolling through London.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: Devon Levesque Built Sweet Honey Farm to Find Community
item.description: An extreme athlete built a wellness lair in New Jersey and turned it into the members-only club of his dreams.
item.dc:creator: Mark Byrne
item.media:credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times
item.media:description: Devon Levesque at Sweet Honey Farm in Marlboro, N.J.

item.title: What’s the Thing Only Ralph Lauren Can Bring?
item.description: The brand’s first men’s only runway show in over 20 years left our critic pleasantly surprised.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: Why Do We Want It to Be 2016 Again?
item.description: A new trend has some social media users feeling nostalgic for a decade ago, but the posts reveal something deeper about the state of the internet.
item.dc:creator: Madison Malone Kircher

item.title: New Nike LeBron Shoe Honors MLK Jr. by Evoking Motel Where He Was Killed
item.description: The new Nike basketball shoe’s all-teal color palette nods to the Memphis motel where Martin Luther King Jr. was assassinated in 1968.
item.dc:creator: Sandra E. Garcia
item.media:description: LeBron James wore a pair of “Honor the King” sneakers this month during a face-off with the Memphis Grizzlies in Los Angeles.

item.title: Unsure What to Wear to a Wedding? You’re Not Alone.
item.description: Wedding dress codes like “black tie optional” are meant to signal a desire for formality without the pressure. But they often cause more confusion than clarity for guests.
item.dc:creator: Tammy LaGorce
item.media:description: Dress codes, many of which are now accompanied by a digital mood board, are meant to offer clear instructions to aid in selecting one’s attire. But for many guests, it often raises more questions than answers.

item.title: A ‘Weird, Wonderful’ Night at the ‘Rocky Horror Picture Show’
item.description: City Winery’s 50th anniversary screening of the film encouraged some inventive dress up, including tributes to fan favorites like Rocky and Dr. Frank-N-Furter.
item.dc:creator: Vidhya Nagarajan and Sarah Bahr

item.title: Walter Steding, Otherworldly One-Man Band and Portraitist, Is Dead at 75
item.description: A self-taught musician, he wore flashing goggles while playing the violin. But his real skill was as a painter, and his portraits offered an eerie commentary on the times.
item.dc:creator: Penelope Green

item.title: They Ran a Campaign Together, Then Love Came After
item.description: When Talia Marcus and Charles Blaettler met while working on the campaign trail, they weren’t expecting love. Good thing it came anyway.
item.dc:creator: Stella Raine Chu

item.title: Please Cheat on Me
item.description: Why did I keep fantasizing about catching my faithful boyfriend in bed with another woman?
item.dc:creator: Rachel Sontag

item.title: A Slow, Awkward Dance Started It All
item.description: Before Paul Melnikow and Alan Pierson spoke to each other, they danced at the ‘queer prom,’ about 20 hours into Taylor Mac’s 24-hour performance.
item.dc:creator: Rosalie R. Radomsky

item.title: For Two Floridians, a Michigan Winter Solidified Their Bond
item.description: Ashley Knott and Tobias Kammerer are opposites — she’s very social, while he needs “to be peeled like an onion.” But a big move created a deeper connection.
item.dc:creator: Linda Marx

item.title: We’re Empty Nesters Now. What Do We Do?
item.description: More time to focus on each other might seem like a good thing, but not every relationship survives the transition to an empty nest.
item.dc:creator: Gina Cherelus
item.media:credit: Cassidy Araiza for The New York Times
item.media:description: Shayla and Mike Dugan at their home, which, as of May, has been empty of children. The couple got their dog Sonny the summer before their oldest child went away to college specifically to help ease Ms. Dugan’s distress.

item.title: How Can I Support a Depressed Friend?
item.description: Our Ask the Therapist columnist, Lori Gottlieb, advises a reader who wants to help a struggling pal but is growing frustrated.
item.dc:creator: Lori Gottlieb

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘I’m 23. He’s 40.’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.

item.title: These Gyms’ Most Intimidating Machine: The Front Door
item.description: A new kind of tap-in, tap-out system at gyms has some New Yorkers flustered.
item.dc:creator: Victor Mather and Alexandra E. Petri

item.title: Star Seize Chance to Speak Out at Night Honoring Leonardo DiCaprio
item.description: Actors and filmmakers were celebrated at the annual National Board of Review gala, where winners called attention to protests in Minneapolis and the violent crackdown in Iran.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Bahr and Nina Westervelt
item.category: National Board of Review of Motion Pictures
If I Had Legs I'd Kick You (Movie)
item.media:credit: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

item.title: Can I Tell My Sister That Our Friends Don’t Want to Travel With Her?
item.description: A reader feels conflicted about taking a trip with friends who specifically asked that a travel-challenged sister not come along for the ride.
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes

item.title: Inside an Exploding Marriage: Belle Burden in Her Own Words
item.description: After 20 years, Belle Burden’s picture-perfect marriage came crashing down when her husband suddenly walked away.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin
item.media:credit: Photo Illustration by The New York Times; Background: Brian Rea; Inset photo: Victor Llorente for The New York Times

item.title: Saks Files for Bankruptcy as Department Stores Fight for Survival
item.description: The parent company of Saks, Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman struggled with debt, designers and customers in recent years.
item.dc:creator: Kim Bhasin, Vanessa Friedman and Lauren Hirsch
item.media:description: Saks Fifth Avenue in New York City was founded in 1924 as a jewel of American retail. The store stands across the street from Rockefeller Center.

item.title: Joel Kim Booster and John Michael Sudsina Are Married
item.description: Joel Kim Booster, the actor and comedian, and John Michael Sudsina became “vacation boyfriends” while in Mexico with friends in May 2021.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan

item.title: At the Golden Globes, the Stars of ‘Heated Rivalry’ Scored Points With Fans
item.description: A Golden Globes appearance by the stars of “Heated Rivalry,” HBO Max’s show about gay hockey players, reflected how it has built a big-tent fan base.
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta
item.media:credit: Kevork Djansezian/CBS Broadcasting, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Connor Storrie, left, and Hudson Williams presenting at the Golden Globes ceremony.

item.title: Teyana Taylor, George Clooney and Jacob Elordi Toast the Golden Globes
item.description: After the final award had been handed out, stars dispersed across Los Angeles for exclusive after-parties at hot spots like Spago and the Chateau Marmont.
item.dc:creator: Juno Carmel
item.media:credit: Michael Buckner/Penske Media, via Getty Images
item.media:description: Teyana Taylor, who won the award for best actress in a supporting role in any motion picture.

item.title: Photos: Backstage With Teyana Taylor, Owen Cooper and More Golden Globe Winners
item.description: Rose Byrne, Owen Cooper, Seth Rogen, Teyana Taylor and other award winners in the spotlight.
item.dc:creator: Chantal Anderson
item.media:credit: Chantal Anderson for The New York Times
